Name: Expanding the definition of public nuisance to include tenant harassment.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the definition of public nuisance to include tenant harassment

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: February 13, 2019 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - February 13, 2019

Summary: This bill would the definition of public nuisances defined in the Nuisance Abatement Law to include acts of tenant harassment.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Section 7-703 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision (s) to read as follows:
      (s) Any act of harassment, as defined in paragraph 48 of subdivision a of section 27-2004 of this code, by an owner committed against any tenant or person lawfully entitled to occupancy of a dwelling unit.   
      ï¿½ 2.  This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
